website_summaries.verdict: The KLIQ clip-on tuner is versatile, accurate and sturdy. Prevails in many head to head comparisons with other tuners. Helps musicians with intonation.
pros: Fast response, with an easy-to-read LED circle
Display can be read in multiple directions while tuning
cons: Tuning range is variable, not always accurate
Does not work well with non-string instruments

customer_reviews.title: This looked like a well made tuner
customer_reviews.text: This looked like a well made tuner, and it worked ok for awhile. After a few months, the tuner started indicating a whole note off of true tone, even with new batteries. This will have to go to the junk heap, as it can't be trusted.
customer_reviews.author: T. Magee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: After several battery changes, and a thorough reading of the instructions (yes, I'm that desperate), I conclude that this is a monumental POS. It powers on, cycles through all the different modes of tuning, but does not actually register that any sound is being made, let alone inform you on its pitch. In short, it sucks.
customer_reviews.author: C. Husser

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to use and more accurate than the Snark tuner which I had been using for years. My only recommendation is that the instructions describe in more detail when to use the different tuning modes. Since I play guitar I changed from the chromatic mode to the guitar mode. This worked fine until I used a capo. To get accurate readings with a capo I had to revert to the chromatic mode. It wasn't hard to figure this out myself; but it would have been helpful had this information been included on the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: GPD

customer_reviews.title: Great company and great tuner
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying I am a beginner guitar student with no knowledge on how to tune a guitar. I bought the KLIQ UberTuner and was amazed at how easy and precise it was to tune the guitar. Even my guitar instructor really liked the unit. After a few months of using the tuner, I had an issue with it. I thought I might be past the warranty period, but I emailed customer service anyways. They contacted me immediately the next day and stated that they would send me a new unit. Great customer service. I totally recommend this company and this tuner.
customer_reviews.author: MANUEL A.

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I'm starting to understand why Amazon puts items on a Lightning Deal. The batteries are dying, and they have to clear out old inventory. They'll knock six bucks off the price of an item so you can spend $5.97 on a new battery. At least, I hope it's just the battery. Yes, I put it in correctly, with the positive terminal in the correct place. But no, it doesn't work. No lights, no tuning. And I don't have a supply of CR 2032 batteries lying around the house. If you do, you might give this tuner a shot, but mine is going back, with a valuable lesson learned about battery-powered Lightning Deals.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan's Guide

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality electronics. Screen flickers and shuts off constantly often won't turn on. Essentially unusable. Thought maybe it just came with a bad battery so I replaced it and made no difference. Was pretty excited about the mount and what seemed like a high quality display but was very disappointed with the actual quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Quail

customer_reviews.title: Replace battery with 2032 NOT 2024
customer_reviews.text: Battery replacement with 2032 (thicker than 2024) solves all dimming problems. As noted by one star reviews, there is a design problem with the “battery cassette” - namely the contacts for the 2024 just barely work. This problem is solved with a thicker battery, the 2032. The battery cassette accepts this battery. Just pop it in, insert it carefully and you are done.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Broke Immediately
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels nice. Works well when it works. Broke during second use. Just suddenly lost the ability to display anything. I bought a snark and remembered why they are my go-to.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not only a great product, but amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best customer response I've ever experienced on Amazon. I had some questions for the vendor and they responded almost immediately - on a Sunday night! I've had lots of different types of tuners, both stand-alone and clip-on, some very expensive, and the Kliq beats them all easily, hands down. To me (I'm a retired electronics design engineer), it appears to be the next generation of technology, or advancement in the (DSP) digital signal processing that has overcome many of the foibles that made previous generation devices so twitchy. This is rock steady. Kudos to the designers and company.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Boatner

customer_reviews.title: Great display and accuracy -- but it rattles!
customer_reviews.text: The tuner is nice and solid -- it's definitely bigger than my little snark, and the display is much cooler. I like how when you get the note tuned just right it lights up a circle. I have it in white, which is cool looking. But, I noticed it rattles!! Especially when striking the lower/heavier gauge strings, like EAD. There is some cheap, loose part in the tuner body that actually vibrates and rattles when you play! For me, the idea is to obtain clean sound -- that is why I tune my instrument. So no -- this one will not do. Returning it for another snark.
customer_reviews.author: AML

customer_reviews.title: EcoTuner is better than UberTuner
customer_reviews.text: Both UberTuner and EcoTuner have similar size and similar functionality. Either one is good. However I prefer EcoTuner for home use. Few things I found make it feel noticeably better for me: * EcoTuner has a non-replaceable battery charged via micro-usb; * UberTuner uses a replaceable CR2032 battery; * EcoTuner shows cents and feels more responsive because of that, allows for much more precision; * UberTuner does not show cents; * EcoTuner's linear bar feels easier to read than UberTuner's circular bar;
customer_reviews.author: onton

customer_reviews.title: Astonishingly Cool
customer_reviews.text: I'm officially impressed. This thing is dead-on accurate, even more than I thought my "trained" ear could detect. What really impresses me is how it isn't just the 6 EADGBe frequencies used for standard-tuning, but every single note you might play... it simply tells you every single note you play. I finally tuned my bridge properly, because this thing tells you just how much you're flat or sharp, so tuning the string length based on fingering the octave (12th) is an unbelievable breeze. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST OF THE CHEAP ONES!
customer_reviews.text: None of these are as accurate as a good (2-grand) oscilloscope, but this one is more accurate than the other cheap ones. It isn't fragile like the Snark, isn't hard on your insttrument's finish like the D'Addario, and is commendably visible. I give it the highest recommendation. I have perfect pitch, so use it to get the instrument "close" to what is right so as to not frazzle my nerves, and then I use my ears to get it spot on. But this unit gets it as close to accurate as you're likely to find.
customer_reviews.author: Baumli

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Im missing something?
customer_reviews.text: This tuner shuts down when it feels like it. And yes I'v'e changer batteries. As a professional, I can't rely on it in the middle of a set. The "ON" button is super hard to find and tiny. For this reason the tuner is not reliable if one needs to tune in the middle of a set. Plus with sun glasses on the display is not very prominent when it is actually on! I need a tuner that stays on and is easy to see under all conditions. Am I missing something?
customer_reviews.author: J. Alice

customer_reviews.title: I own 6 clip on tuners
customer_reviews.text: Super big and bright. It's also fast. Here's a photo comparing some of the popular tuners.
customer_reviews.author: Blues Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to read, and holds a charge. Perfect for timid and/or apartment dwelling folks that play an electric unamplified - or plugged into headphones, but I am not ready to hear myself that loudly yet - cringe. But, this little beauty tunes based on vibration of the guitar body, so no plugging in needed. Recharge feature is great. Its been over a month, and it still is pretty fully charged. Great little tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice tuner but
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tuner but doesn't have enough accuracy in its display. Tuning moves the display in large chunks up or down. You cannot see any areas IN BETWEEN these chunks. They are either lit or not. You can have all your strings displaying green (in tune) but if you use a tuner with a needle and pinpoint accuracy, you will see that you are still out of tune. I can hear the difference. Maybe I am just picky?
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Fastest tuner I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: The tuner is very fast and easy to read. Since it doesn't have a setting such as guitar or bass, I'm able to use it on my six and seven string electric guitars. I also use it to tune my four, five and six string basses. The read out is very bright and colorful, which makes it easy to read while paying more attention to tuning your instrument as opposed to figuring out what the display is showing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Black

customer_reviews.title: Way better than Snark, worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tuner after snapping the head off of two Snark tuners in my gig bag. I decided I needed something a little more solidly made. This certainly fits that description, but what I'm even more impressed with is how well it works compared to the two Snarks I had. Those tuners were very slow, finicky and difficult to get a clear reading on. This thing finds the note instantly and tells you exactly where you are in a split second. It also registers the B string on my 5-string bass just as well as the other strings without having to hit the harmonic at the twelfth fret. Very happy with it on initial use. Hopefully it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Lolly

customer_reviews.title: NOPE
customer_reviews.text: I have used Snarks for years and they seem to have dropped in quality, accuracy, and durability. Trying the KLIQ. Feels quality and performs well so far. Control on off buttons are a bit small. UPDATE: changed from 5 Star to 1 Star. Not at all user friendly. On/Off button is ridiculously small, hard to locate, and has to be pressed down and held for a few seconds for it to function. Takes longer to turn it on & off than it does to tune a string. Erratic tuning. Sometimes does not register at all. I thought I was buying a superior product and it’s the opposite. I am going back to Snarks.
customer_reviews.author: horsespatoot

customer_reviews.title: FAST. Worth the extra money if you play everyday. MUCH better than the Snark.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Snark a year ago. It works fine. It is precise. The problem is, it is not fast enough. The response is lacking. The Kliq costs twice as much and works so much better. I tune up is about 1/3 the time I do with a Snark. That is it. Simple. It has a big, bright screen that is easy to use. If you do not mind taking much more time, buy a cheaper one. If you want a fast, accurate tuner, get the Kliq.
customer_reviews.author: Rupert Picante

customer_reviews.title: Great item but is so low it's hard to see
customer_reviews.text: I would give this product 5 stars, but it failed in 1 way. VISIBILITY. I am a beginner. I can tune my violin just fine but when I'm running scales, I like to have my tuner on so I can follow intonation closely and get my ear trained. I actually have 3 different tuners, and to be honest, they all do the same basic stuff. However, the Ubertuner and the Korg are so low profile, that when I'm playing, it is nearly impossible to see it. That is where the ancient CP-2 rose up to the occasion. It stands higher and has more tilt so that I can see it over my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Product was already opened. Packaging very damaged. Seriously??
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift to a family member. I noticed immediately that the box was in bad shape; it was heavily scratched up and covered in some sort of dust. There was no seal or sticker keeping the box closed and the top flap was bent and also heavily damaged. Additionally, the battery was just rattling loose in the packaging, not even in the little plastic compartment at all. Maybe the tuner works great, but what a horrible customer experience. If you're going to send returned merchandise out to customers, at least put it in presentable packaging! I cannot give this as a gift. Jesus christ
customer_reviews.author: CatW

customer_reviews.title: Good, but two problems
customer_reviews.text: This tuner works well, and I like the display. But there are two significant problems with it: First, it's big. If you're using it with a guitar or a bass, that might not be a problem. If you want to use it with a soprano ukulele, it'll work, but it would look ridiculous and might take up too much room in the instrument's case. Even with my baritone uke it's bigger than I'd like. Second, it chews up batteries significantly faster than my other (Fishman) tuner. If I were buying another tuner for my ukes I'd probably go with something different.
customer_reviews.author: rsholmes

customer_reviews.title: NICE..
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to save a few bucks and got a cheaper piec of ****. It was made in Korea, very small and did not work. I got frustrated and tossed it. I ordered this tuner. It was packaged extremely good to protect it. It had a battery try so it would sit where it is supposed to. I am legally blind and could see the very nice size and display. Do not srttle to save a few bucks and then throw it away. You already lost money. Buy this one, you won't be sorry. ROCK ON BROTHER, ROCK ON...
customer_reviews.author: Snapper

customer_reviews.title: Tuner does not do its job
customer_reviews.text: At the first day when I got this, it worked perfectly. Now, it has been less than one week and does not work well. I mean the turner itself can be turned on but it displays wrong thing. For example, I am using it for violin and it displays D for E string. Because of this, A string is broken 2 weeks after I buy it. I have two tuners and one another just works with no problem displaying right thing. I think this tuner is not worth to buy.
customer_reviews.author: ByeongHo Ban

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect instructions on inserting battery
customer_reviews.text: This item was dead on arrival. I inserted the enclosed battery as directed, held down the power key for at least the required two seconds, and absolutely nothing happened. It is totally non-functional. Don't waste your money on this piece of junk. CORRECTION: Just on a hunch I tried inserting the CR2032 battery upside down from what the instructions indicate, and now the unit seems to work fine, so I have raised this review from one star to 4 stars and would have given it 5 stars except for the extremely poor instructions on how to insert the battery.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dotson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I just received it but it is working great so far. Having never used one of these before I was a little intimidated on whether I was going to figure it out (I’m not the most mechanical). I used to tune using my piano (and years ago with a tuning fork). But I learned how to use it in less than 5 minutes on my own and it’s much easier than the old days to get the right pitch. I haven’t tuned to anyone else yet but I based on my ear it seems to be very accurate..
customer_reviews.author: Kathy N.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and readable in sunlight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this KLIQ Uber Tuner on Thursday, and it arrived today, Saturday. I immediately tried it out. It works great! It is very stable and accurate and doesn't jump around much at all. One of the main reasons I wanted it is i play outside with my band often and the tuner(s) that I use are almost useless even when playing outside in the shade. As you can see from my photo, this one is readable in direct sunlight. That's Awesome!! The only con is, I wish it would mount behind the headstock. I love it so much, I immediate bought 3 more for my other guitars!
customer_reviews.author: Crafterplayer

customer_reviews.title: Design does not adapt to French horns.  my rating is specific to that instrument
customer_reviews.text: the large spring clip does not anchor well/ stay clipped to round tubing on the valve cluster of a french horn (where I might be able to see the tuner face) and wont span the conical seciton of the bell tail. Cannot fit in the open space past the 3rd valve of a kruspe wrap french horn. If clipped to the bell, Horn player cannot see the tuner. I may try to disconnect the tuner arm from the spring clip and fabricate a mount that will fit into the Lyre receiver. if that is not possible, the tuner goes back.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great Tuner!
customer_reviews.text: Great tuner! I bought the "other One", the round one and when it died, it DIED! This one works really well, its' strudy and I can use it to tune my ukuleles, my baritone uke and my bass guitars and U-Bass. It's more expensive but I think this one is really accurate. It's very easy to read, even in sunlight. I've bought two, I believe, from Amazon. As a professional musician and singer, I'd really recommend this tuner. Great value for the price especially. It's sturdy enough that when I add my McGyber-ed, home-made music holder, it stays steady and strong and hasn't busted. Yet. That's a lot of pressure to put on plastic so I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Mia Who Sings

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed at how well this worked!
customer_reviews.text: I tried tuning my guitar using an older style tuner and was having difficulties getting the tones right. With this tuner, I still don't understand the instructions about other settings, but it worked right out of the box - and was so easy to get the tone right! Maybe there's something wrong in the electronics that doesn't let it set it up for the other instrument, but my guitar has never sounded more beautiful. Tuning is so easy! I keep it clipped to my classical guitar.
customer_reviews.author: mongopop

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with tuner for use with double bass, not so much with my kid losing it at camp :)
customer_reviews.text: Our son plays the double bass and is on his third tuner. We have been very happy with it—it’s easy to use and to change batteries. Unfortunately by the time he needed to change the battery, he’s gotten rosin all over it so we bought a new one, which he lost the last day of his camp, so three’s The charm. Easily attaches to the bass, easy to read, nice display. The price means that I didn’t yell at him (too much.) the battery seemed to be good for over a year of use, and he used it 8-9 times a week for his various classes, lessons, and orchestras.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Check functions as soon as possible
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 10 months ago, just before the order was delivered, given an instrument that had electronics with built in tuner. Just unpacked and used today (4/6/19), found the power key is not operable. My own fault for not checking and removing the battery is the manual switch. Otherwise, excellent tuner and much easier to use than a couple of other tuners I have used.
customer_reviews.author: JomiChan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this tuner! It attaches easily to both my lever harp (on the soundboard) and my baritone ukulele, and I can see its display even in bright sunlight (a problem with some other tuners). The tuning is precise, and the batteries last a long time. I find it as accurate and adjustable as the Snark, which is a great tuner but invariably breaks within months because of the design flaw (it uses a ball-and-socket rotation, but the plastic holding the head to the ball joint is VERY weak). I would happily buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great little tuner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tuner. I sent it to my guitar student, we do lessons over Zoom during this coronavirus pandemic, and it only took a couple of minutes to explain how it worked for my student to be on top of things and now always in tune! The screen is super bright, and when the string is just the exact right length, the indicator is very clear that you're in tune by putting a big green circle around the note name in the middle of the screen. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Southard

customer_reviews.title: Great investment, easy to use and accurate!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. I hope it will survive being in my guitar case. I plan on getting some pluck and pull foam and placing it in that space to protect my wireless receiver, capo and this tuner. It completely tuned my 12 string effortlessly as my hearing has diminished over the course of a 24 year Army career. I highly recommend this tuner. Only down is the battery, it’s a disk watch battery and I don’t tend to have these laying around. Still it’s a great investment!
customer_reviews.author: J Stokes

customer_reviews.title: My Snark is so much better
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a horrible tuner, but definitely not a 5 star. My Snark tuner is much better. This one takes a good 3+ seconds to "boot up", while the Snark is instant on. The button is a little finicky on getting it to turn on and shut down. Yes, it also takes time to shut down as well. I also find it doesn't seem to catch onto the note too easily, not like the Snark. I had the Snark first and bought this thinking it would be an upgrade - it is not.
customer_reviews.author: wanger77

customer_reviews.title: Good product - good service
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these tuners. I recently ordered a 2nd one from Amazon and it was not up to par. It read about 10 cents high in pitch when measured against a friend's strobe tuner. Sent it back with no hassle and got a replacement. Now have 2 tuners that work very well. Are they as good as a quality strobe tuner? No. Do they work well for getting in tune to practice? Yes. They're OK for setting intonation but don't always reliably pick up the higher octave properly on a guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Eason

customer_reviews.title: Worst Tuner in 25 Years
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst tuner I’ve used in 25 years. I have a standard 4/4 violin and this would not stay on my violin. Not only that, but the arm doesn’t turn enough so even if it had stayed on I can’t turn the display anywhere that I’d be able to see it.
customer_reviews.author: kristin87

customer_reviews.title: Great product and Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a musical moron (other than enjoying it) and decided to remedy that by taking guitar lessons this year. I snatched one of these up on Amazon after seeing the good reviews because I was absolutely sure I could never tune my guitar myself. This tuner makes it so easy to stay in tune that even I can do it! The visuals are very clear, so my farsighted eyeballs can still see them without problem, without reading glasses. Also, the Customer Service is FANTASTIC with this company. They really care that you like the product and you are satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid tuner and a company that stands behind it
customer_reviews.text: I had four Snarks before buying my first KLIQ, and the KLIQ is superior. Takes a fraction of a second longer for the KLIQ to power up/power down, so the cadence is slightly different from that of a Snark. The KLIQ display is brighter and easier to read. My first KLIQ arrived with a loose connection in the gooseneck which secures the screen to the clip. I contacted KLIQ's customer service and they courteously, immediately shipped a replacement. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Britt Justice

customer_reviews.title: An easy to use and precise instrument
customer_reviews.text: I found this tuner an excellent choice. It is small and fits easily on my guitar with a clip. It can be angled for visibility. The tuner is very accurate and precise. It makes the tuning process extremely easy and retuning takes seconds. As a new player, I found this a great aid in helping me recognize the correct pitch and sound for each string. I would recommend being careful opening the package as the included battery is packaged loosely and can pop out. I would also note that the instructions are printed quite small and are terse. However, they are accurate and it is very easy to learn how to use the tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Having Problems
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this Tuner about 2 or so months ago. everything was working perfectly and loved it until the last several days. I hold the power button to turn on and it turns back off, I do it again several times and it does it again until it finally stays on after 5 or so attempts and yes I have replaced the battery even though I think it was too soon.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: A New sUBER Tuner!!
customer_reviews.text: This year was my 20th year playing the classical guitar. From the vintage Seiko manual tuner that I owned to Intellitouch tuner PT1 to this - KLIQ UberTuner. I must say I really enjoy the super large screen and very bright display, but its small enough to fit in any guitar case compartment. Tuning is fast and accurate. Clip is big and snug, also the joint between the clip and the display screen is able to rotate 360 degrees. Making adjustments very easy at your own preference. All in all, a very well-built tuner. P/S: Definitely not a typical "China-made" tuner! Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Desmond Lim

customer_reviews.title: Should be 5+ stars
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small, reliable tuner for when my inline tuner won't do. I looked at a number of tuners and read lots of reviews and decided on the KLIQ UberTuner. This is great. It makes tuning my guitars a snap and it small and yet has a very visible screen in any conditions I have used it in so far. It's well thought out in design and functionality. This is my go to tuner now. OK, I'll use a pun.... you KLIQ guys rock!
customer_reviews.author: MBuckner

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Kliq offers great customer service. Above and beyond what I see other companies providing. I had an issue with my unit 18+ months after purchase and after a quick email Kliq offered to send me a replacement. When I checked my email for the original shipping information I also noticed that a few days after original purchase, Kliq sent an email thanking me for my choice. This company appears to strive to take care of its customers from the beginning to the end. Thank you Kliq! You are backing a great product. I use the tuner on both Bass and regular guitars. Very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Adventures in Video

customer_reviews.title: having used several tuners I was looking forward to getting ...
customer_reviews.text: having used several tuners I was looking forward to getting this one after reading about it, I find it very hard to turn on, having to hold the button an extended time, and hard and clumsy to position, however it seems to do ok tuning, for my money the snark beats it hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Gone

customer_reviews.title: Only use it when I perform - but great for that
customer_reviews.text: This tuner is as good as it gets - apart from the human ear. I prefer to tune to a tuning fork and then use harmonics and then check at the 10th & 9th frets across the fingerboard, but if you have to tune quickly, this is the tuner you need. Offers instrument options and precision adjustment. Easy reset: just pull out the battery drawer and then put it back in. Love it, as electronic tuners go. Clamp is great - doesn't mark my headstock.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Technique

customer_reviews.title: A Dud...but good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a Snark for years...wanted an extra tuner to keep in my case instead of forgetting it every time I went somewhere..so I purchased this and spent a bit more for what I thought was a better tuner... well it only lasted a few months of use and now nothing...I even replaced the battery..with 3 different batteries ...I even took the one out of my working Snark and put it in this...still nothing...sorry to say I’m back to trying to remember my tuner all of the time...Can’t recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: LucyLou

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I am not a great player. The last tuner I bought was 20 years ago. It never worked great and it took so long to get things in tune. The KLIQ tuner is easy and fast. I tune in seconds. The screen is bright and very easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all second unit, amazon service is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all. Took 3 extra days to arrive, ask for exchanged waited 5 more days for another unit that only responds to very high volume and a few notes. While a waited for late delivery on replacement it said a could return. But the only free drop off is a university book store in the middle of the covid plague. I'm not young I'm supposed to die for this junk.!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DHueber

customer_reviews.title: Really like this tuner!
customer_reviews.text: My effects processor has a tuner included, but I got tired of always having to turn on the processor and go to the tuner mode every time I wanted to check the tuning on my guitar, so I took a chance and bought the Uber tuner. It is easy to use, convenient, and accurate. I love it. This is my first try at this kind of tuner, so don't know how it compares to manufactures, but I can tell you that I am happy I got this tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Ski Vieira

customer_reviews.title: When There is a problem, they handle it promptly
customer_reviews.text: Bought two (one for me and one for my son) based upon reviews. Both came with dead batteries. Adding 10 bucks for new batteries makes this a much poorer value. It works as advertised. UPDATE - The seller contacted me after my initial review and both refunded my purchase price and gave me $10 for the batteries that I had to buy. I felt that was extremely gracious and generous of them. For that reason, I am upgrading my review to 5 stars from the initial 2. I have had some time to use this tuner and like it a lot. I would buy it again. Thanks so much KLIQ Music Gear for your wonderful service.
customer_reviews.author: CPLAZ

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for upright bass.
customer_reviews.text: I put this tuner on the bridge of my upright bass. Super stout construction. Very easy to read. Accurate, stable and responsive metering. Correctly identifies the low E string on my upright bass - another clip-on brand I've used often confuses my low E with C. This affordable tuner is worth every penny. Very glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner - slow to power on / off
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around quite a bit before buying this tuner and I really like it - a lot - except for one thing. You have to hold the power switch for three seconds to get this unit to power on or off. That is an eternity if you are trying to tune in between songs at a live gig and I deducted one star for that issue. Aside from that this tuner rocks! You’ll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner!  I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I have a Chromatic tuner pedal that doesn't get used anymore. I use this so much. I use it for bridge setup, calibration and intonation. I would check it against the Chromatic tuner pedal and it is right on. This thing is great. It is so good I bought one for my brother in law because I know he wouldn't believe me and not buy one. He loves it too. It makes tuning a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Chupacabra

customer_reviews.title: Graphics could use some subtlty
customer_reviews.text: My 4 instead of 5 stars is purely on aesthetic grounds. Most of this oversized screen is used for the graphics with candy-ass colors. It looks like a neon billboard lighting up the tuners on my bass. Just look at the picture of the item. At least 30% of this giant screen is used to draw the big colorful circle. I'm old and my eyesight isn't what it used to be but this extra space and colorfulness doesn't help.
customer_reviews.author: ziphler

customer_reviews.title: You may also need something to measure Hz
customer_reviews.text: This tuner works well and is easy to use. My only complaint, and it cost me a set of new strings, is that it doesn’t report Hz; it only reports the note itself and if it is flat or sharp. I’m not a natural so I accept all the help I can get and one item I would like is a Hz report so I know which octave the “C” is. I was an octave too high and I snapped a string using your product. I found an app on line for Hz, I used it to set up and then your product became helpful. I use it daily to tune before I practice and it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Held

customer_reviews.title: Overall great tuner (usage and accuracy), at bit large for my taste - battery life so-so
customer_reviews.text: I think overall it's a great tuner and it is very, very accurate. I had a very simplistic chromatic tuner prior to this model and honestly I rather liked the smaller footprint on the end of my guitar, it's really just a looks thing, so that may not matter to you. I won't replace the device, it's a fine tuner and, again, the way the tuner operates is very smooth and highly accurate. The a battery life is so-so (moderate), or that's my experience so far. I have yet to see how it is outside in the sunlight, so that will be a good test.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Not Really Happy - Connection between tuner arm and clamp too loose
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product a lot, but one defect makes it unusable. The interface between the tuner arm and the clamp that positions the tuner is so loose that gravity causes it to drop so you can no longer see the display. I tried to find a way to tighten the interface, but you cannot access it. Maybe I got a bad one, but I do not recommend this product due to this defect.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Finke

customer_reviews.title: So nice I bought two!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it twice! The first one for my daughter who is just starting guitar lessons and needs a little help tuning her guitar. Once she tried it, my husband (bass player for a local band playing 3 or 4 gigs a month) got a little jealous that her tuner was nicer than his so I bought a second one for him to use for his gigs. Both are very happy with this little tuner. Easy to use, easy to read in bright or low light.
customer_reviews.author: Farmwife97

customer_reviews.title: Easy read !
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my guitar and on my Monochord, it's so easy to see and use and the rubber grips on the clamp really hold well and protect my instruments. This has a bigger and brighter screen than the Snark I was using and is a better quality that I don't see breaking at the neck like my Snark. It grips the tuning pegs on my monochord for easy tuning. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Linlea

customer_reviews.title: Works fast and is accurate
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this twice after I broke the first one (there's a little battery drawer, it doesn't come apart like a clam...) I had bought another one because I wanted a rechargeable one and when I used this a lot the battery died fast. Now I use it mostly for tuning, and it's quick, accurate and doesn't use too much battery. I'll be going with this one from now on, although I do wish it were rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenlyn

customer_reviews.title: The best clip on tuner
customer_reviews.text: In my experience this is the first clip on tuner that is exactly what I need. The size is large enough to see accurately but not to big. It is about the size of those round clip on tuners. It does something other clip on tuners don’t do... it can be adjuster so you can see the tuner right side up so you can see the “in tune” pointer is pointing north not south where everything is upside down like a lot of other clip on tuners. This tuner is extremely accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Cow

customer_reviews.title: Good, BUT
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tuner for the money I spent. Having said that, we’ve got a beginner trombonist in the house and it took digging through these reviews to figure out that it HAS to be clipped on to the instrument to work because it needs the vibration. For several frustrating minutes I thought I’d bought a dud. You guys need to make that more obvious for dummies like me. Otherwise, good product. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ronalda

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably good!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, FAST, accurate, big bright screen, flexible, well built -- the list goes on and on. I've used a bunch of tuners for my guitars and basses, and this one's simply the best. It's worth the couple extra dollars. What I like best -- gives me a QUICK read on the lowest strings on the bass, including low-B on the five string. Some of my tuners can't even find that note! What I like least -- using the buttons is tricky for anything other than on/off, and the instructions are scanty. Get this tuner, and speed up your tuning!
customer_reviews.author: NomDePlume

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read - compact - great on stage or in studio!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my Zon Bass, Fender Strat, Hurdy Gurdy, Sarod, and Tanpura. On the Indian instruments, I clip it to one of the tuning pegs. I really like the bold colors & bright visibility. It forms a perfect circle when the note is spot-on - a Big Plus! I use a lot of altered tunings, and also different Hz (432, 400 & 440) - so this is now an indispensable piece of equipment for me. I could see where this would be a very wise choice for someone learning to play the Fretless Bass - it provides instant feedback on your note accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: steven sunn

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great display, bright and easy to read. Tuning is spot on. Oversized clip is very sturdy and easy to use. (not like some cheaper models that break after a while). only issue is on/off button is clumsy and too small. location is off to one side, instead of on top. Awkward to hold button down for 2 seconds to turn off. I can adjust to it. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C

customer_reviews.title: Best Clip-On Tuner, So Far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tuner for my oud. For years I’ve been using older, disposable battery-operated clip-on tuners with varying accuracy and battery life. This one is very sensitive, and so much more accurate. I have only used it for the first time after the initial charge, so I can’t speak for its battery life just yet, but in case I do run out of juice, I don’t need to go looking for a battery anymore. I can just recharge via USB. The compact size makes it unbtrusive, and the display is bright and easy to read. I love this tuner.
customer_reviews.author: siro777

customer_reviews.title: Worked well even for a beginner!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to tune my son's cello. I have never used one of these for any instrument and I have never tuned a cello before. After using it and deciding ok it should be accurate I took it to a professional who checked it out and said they only needed to make minor tuning adjustments. So mission accomplished, it worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Really good little tuner.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tuner for about 8 months now and have been using it pretty steadily. The original battery lasted me 8 months and I replaced it the other day. A couple of my guitars have custom headstocks that I modified and have very little area for the clip to grab onto but the KLIQ actually stays on them and doesn't fall off. The screen is so easy to see and read plus it has a few modes to choose from like chromatic, guitar, violin and bass guitar. I also like that the clamp has rubber in it to protect from slipping and/or scratching the headstock.
customer_reviews.author: Hulktaur

customer_reviews.title: Almost a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly accurate enough, but just good enough to keep. Still though, considering how poor the tuning accuracy is, it should cost half of what it it is priced at. It does have a nice display, and seems well constructed, but the tuning accuracy just isn't there. Hopefully they improve this thing in the future, but as of now. I'm not impressed. Don't get me wrong, they are definitely on to something here. It just isn't there yet.
customer_reviews.author: The Lightning Count

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and seems accurate
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this tuner for the 90 year old father of a friend who was having trouble figuring out how to tune his mandolin accurately...we loved the tuner because it visually signaled whether the note was flat or sharp and also via the central green ring when he hit the precisely the right note. This allowed him to rapidly tune ...much better than the pipes he had been using ... too bad it will not signal when you sing the right note too...Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie McKean

customer_reviews.title: Make Tuning My Instuments A Breeze
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago I bought a new flute and the seller threw in a battery operated tuner. It wasn't configured like the KLIQ UberTuner. The padded UberTuner clip made it very easy to use. Just clip it at the base of the violin scroll, turn it on and move the screen so that you can play the violin without having to take your hands off the bow and violin. This tuner is way better than the no name tuner I use to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Seabarkrob

customer_reviews.title: Key of C does not register at all & have 2 of these
customer_reviews.text: Bizarre--both of the tuners I have in this model will not register C at any level skips from B ranges to D with no inbetween. I get the other strings in tune and then use ear and fret to do C tuning of string. Two stars only because like recharging feature and attaches to guitar better than others I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Jaim

customer_reviews.title: The last time I tuned my guitar, these had not been invented!
customer_reviews.text: I wish this product was available 60 years ago, when I was playing a LOT of guitar. It is a very practical and useful product, which makes the arduous task of tuning a breeze. In addition, one can tune other stringed instruments with this device. It is a bargain at $20 - I would have paid ten times that only a few decades ago!
customer_reviews.author: drjim

customer_reviews.title: Old Dog Still Learning New Tricks
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't picked up my guitar in years and I'd always tuned it by listening to a favorite song and making adjustments by ear. So, when I recently decided to put new strings on that guitar and see if I could get my fingertips back in shape, I also decided try the KLIQ Ubertuner. Wow, what a difference that made in the sound, not to mention the savings in time. To give the folks reading this a reference point for why I find this device so great: I first played in a garage band in the mid-1960s. For an old dog, former musician this is worthwhile technology. You see, we can learn new tricks.
customer_reviews.author: William V.

customer_reviews.title: Display just stopped working after about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: When I got this, I was really happy with the product. It was just as advertised... then 2 months into it, the display didn't turn on. Okay... I have had Snarks in the past and if you leave it on a few times, the battery drains. I had 2 new Duracell batteries available... wouldn't turn on. Tried the other battery... wouldn't turn on. Checked the battery in my Snark... battery is good. If you want something this is unreliable for a concert or rehearsal, this product is for you!
customer_reviews.author: James T Brown

customer_reviews.title: I' m just learning to play the ukulele and was ...
customer_reviews.text: I' m just learning to play the ukulele and was having trouble tuning it. I had an electronic tuner which just wasn't doing the trick. I saw this advertised and decided to give it a try. Soooooo glad I did. I can now tell if I'm just a little out of tune, either going up the scale or down it. I feel so much more confident that I'm hitting the right note and not just hoping that I'm close. Wish I'd bought this when I purchased my ukulele it would have saved me so much frustration.
customer_reviews.author: marion saunders

customer_reviews.title: Great little tuner.
customer_reviews.text: Received the tuner in only 3.5 days. Nice when the store gets your order off quick. The hardest part of using your new Uber Tuner is going to be getting it unboxed and installing the battery. Read the directions and start using it! Simple, small with a bright readable display no matter the environment (Noisy or bright) . I've used it on one acoustic and three electric guitars (including one bass). I wish I had purchased one of these sooner - great product!
customer_reviews.author: P. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product,, OUTSTANDING COMPANY!!
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review before this one and it was not a good one...the very next day in the morning Kliq customer service got ahold of me and eagerly made it right..I am VERY impressed with the level of customer service this company employs ...anyway that being said I now change my rating to I LOVE IT!!! Thank you Kliq for making what looked like a bad situation into a terrific one, something few companies these days can do...If anyone is on the fence with this product i hope this review will help you decide... (by the way the tuner works better than any tuner I have ever used)
customer_reviews.author: brownboyTop Contributor: Ukuleles

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Great tuner, and offers flexibility if you have multiple instruments in different ranges. The buttons and UI was kinda strange at first, but quickly was able to navigAte how to change instrument range as needed. The clip also feels good, and decent grip to the neck on my fender tell, and fender squire bass. Note that it uses one of those watch style batteries rather than AAA, wasn’t a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Whitty

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great tuner.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tuner. Easier to use than anything I have used in the past. I use it on my electric guitars and on my acoustic guitars, even the 12 string. The only thing I have that I wish it worked on is a mandolin. It's a sturdy unit that just Clips onto the headstock of your guitar, bass, or other instrument except of course the mandolin. I have no regrets buying it, it was well worth what I spent for it which wasn't a lot. I plan on buying one for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennda

customer_reviews.title: Large and Hard to Turn On and Off.
customer_reviews.text: This tuner works great but is larger than most and is a little hard to turn on and off. The on-off button has to be held down for a couple seconds to function. The larger color display is nice. I prefer the smaller Snark tuner. I bought several because the Chinese knock-offs have weak pivots and all broken within an year. This one has a very robust clamp and I think will hold up well. However, I would not buy this product again for the reasons noted.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to get this tuner to work. The display won't stay lit and I have changed the new battery with no luck. I will be returning this tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best one I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I have three tuners and have been through a couple more over the years. This is the only tuner that will do the bottom string on a 5 string bass. It is concise and I can tune anything in a noisy room with no troubles. This is my second purchase of this tuner; this one for a guitar class. I don't want the students messing with my own tuner, and yet, this one does the job faster and better than any one I've had for the students.
customer_reviews.author: John Hermanson

customer_reviews.title: Cool tuner but unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: Nice tuner. Unreliable. Bought in Aug 2019. Now the unit won’t stay on after turning the tuner on. Unit powers up and immediately shuts off. Replaced battery. Still didn’t stay in. Sometimes after like 30 tries powering on it will stay on and tune. However once it’s turned off will not power on and stay on. Well taken care of also. Went to this unit due to snarks plastic socket breaking. Might go back to that because it lasted forever.
customer_reviews.author: Nick o.

customer_reviews.title: If you play guitar, you need this tuner.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tuner! It is so easy to read, easy to use, I keep it near or on my guitar to help me tune it up each time I use it. You just have to know that your guitar strings are E, A, D, G, B, E from top to bottom for a right handed player. Oh, and you have to switch the tuner to Guitar mode which is the second mode.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Usual failure issues of snark clip on tuners. Big and clunky.  Too big for my electric case
customer_reviews.text: works fine, with the usual failure point being the ball joint. it WILL break at some point. they ALL do. The big issue I have with this tuner is it's larger than the normal snark tuner. it barely fits in my small electric guitar built-in storage space (guitar strap, a couple of packs of strings, and this tuner).
customer_reviews.author: D S

customer_reviews.title: This is the best, most accurate
customer_reviews.text: Forget the Snark. This is the best, most accurate, easiest to read tuner I have ever used on any instrument. I have owned so many tuners over the years, and I now use only this one bc it simply outshines them all. Literally. These are so very easy to read compared to every other tuner, even the Snarks. I now use this on Guitar, Bass Guitar, Ukulele, Banjo, Mandolin, Violin and Viola. These work perfectly, and are worth every penny I paid for each one of the 3 Kliq tuners I now own.
customer_reviews.author: tj

customer_reviews.title: Quick response and very clear display
customer_reviews.text: In comparing it to my last clip on tuner, it's not quite as accurate, i.e. sharp/flat. However, I have no way of knowing if the older tuner was accurate to begin with. So far, quick response and very clear display. It's an improvement over my last clip on tuner, i.e. larger display and quicker reading response.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Clayton

customer_reviews.title: The KLIQ tuner was exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I have to other tuners that broke almost immediately. One just out of the box adjusted the head to see the tuner and the three prong snap clip broke out. The Snark is a tuner I'll never buy again. KLIQ makes great products I have other product for my musical instruments made by them. They work flawless and I DO NOT have to use airplane glue to use them!
customer_reviews.author: GManMi

customer_reviews.title: It's a paperweight
customer_reviews.text: This tuner is completely dead on arrival. It does not turn on - it does not do anything. It is a piece of crap. Now I get to spend ten minutes packing it up in a box, then twenty minutes going to UPS to stand in line to send it back to Amazon. Thanks, guys - your cheap poorly made tuner cost me an afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after one week
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to read--when it was working. However, it stopped working one week after purchase. It turns on and all the colors appear as if it is working, then the colors go off. When I tried to tune to a string it does not respond. I replaced the battery and that made no difference. I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: L. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a way to better tune to E and D minor... those options oddly were NOT in ANY of the tuners I could find in Play Store (Android)!! I felt really bummed cuz it's such an easy thought! But when it comes to accuracy this shines! Easy to see/read, looks attractive, auto shut off after 3 mins of no sound! It's Great!!
customer_reviews.author: Fredrik Von Weedleburg

customer_reviews.title: It just works.
customer_reviews.text: the clamp is attached to the tuner (not two separate pieces) and still fully articulates; another maker's tuner was in two separate pieces and would sometimes come apart while being positioned; eventually the socket (of the ball and socket) broke... can't really be repaired. This one is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jon C. Farrar

customer_reviews.title: It's OK. Use an app instead.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work OK for my violin. Sometimes you have to play each note slowly otherwise it doesn't register. Placement of tuner also seems to be very important/finicky. After I bought this, I found out there are iPad tuner apps that work better, effectively making these types of tuners obsolete.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Lee

customer_reviews.title: Now we do not have to wait for their lesson and practice is much more fun for my children and to our ears as well
customer_reviews.text: The KLIQ tuner has made me a ROCK STAR dad to my kids as I can tune their violins to perfection with little effort. Now we do not have to wait for their lesson and practice is much more fun for my children and to our ears as well :) The tuner is very easy to use. Intuitive. Clips right onto the Violin. I am also thinking I can use it on our piano but have not researched this further so not certain on Piano. Viola, Violin,----Perfect. I have used it for about 2 weeks. A+
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great little tuner!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a small tuner that I plug my instrument cable in to for several years. I decided to pick up one of these Kliq tuners as I was tired of unplugging/replugging while practicing and trying to keep in tune. This thing clips onto the headstock and picks up vibrations in the wood and shows what note you are playing. It was correct relative to my plug-in tuner for EADG (bass), but I really appreciate the chromatic mode for alternative tunings. The fact that it's rechargeable is a nice plus, too!
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Carlson

product_meta.title: KLIQ UberTuner - Professional Clip-On Tuner for All Instruments - with Guitar, Ukulele, Violin, Bass & Chromatic Tuning Modes
feature_bullets: FAST & ACCURATE: Spend more time playing, and less time tuning. The UberTuner's advanced Micro Processor and highly sensitive Piezo Sensor will ensure your instrument is accurately tuned in a flash.
SUPER BRIGHT DISPLAY: The large color display allows you to easily see if you're flat, sharp, or dead-on from any angle. With 3 points of adjustment, you can position the screen in any way you like.
EASY TO USE: Turn it on, clip it on, and you're ready to tune. Since the tuner detects the pitches directly from your instruments' vibrations, ambient room noise will never get in the way.

RELIABLE: With a strong and durable design, this tuner was built to last. From light use by the music hobbyist to heavy abuse by the touring road warrior, the UberTuner will get you in tune every time.
3-YEAR MANUFACTURER GUARANTEE: In the unlikely event the KLIQ UberTuner breaks or stops working, we'll replace it or give you 100% of your money back, no questions asked.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,735 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
